resources.string:
"Help improve OpenStreetMap with StreetComplete!
This app finds missing map data in your vicinity and displays it on a map as quests. Solve each quest by visiting the location on-site and answering a simple question to update the map.
The info you enter is directly added to OpenStreetMap in your name, without the need to use another editor."
"Can’t scan here. Try to zoom in further or tilt the map less."
"Stop the current search and scan here instead?"
"Location is off. Open Settings to turn it on now?"
"Location permission is needed to show your position on the map and scan for quests in your vicinity."
Zoom in further to create a note
You can leave a note to let other mappers know about an issue here. Adjust the note’s position by moving the map:
Ideally, write the note in the local language, or otherwise in English.
Are you sure that you can not determine it more specifically?
The road in the illustration is rotated the same as its center on the map.
This quest type is disabled by default because you will likely have to enter the place to be able to answer a quest of this type.
This quest type is disabled by default because it is not useful in some regions and you will likely have to enter the place to be able to answer a quest of this type.
You need a tape measure to solve this quest because measuring with the camera is not supported on this device.
This quest type is disabled by default because it is either time-consuming or difficult to make the right choice. Only enable this quest type if you are really committed to adding this kind of data.
This quest type is disabled by default because there is already an overlay with which it is more effective and efficient to enter and update this data.
"This quest type is disabled by default because it may require re-checking the situation at a specific part of the year."
"You can leave a public note for other mappers to resolve at this location, or hide this quest for yourself only"
"Are you sure that it does not exist, not even at a slightly different location? If you’re not sure, leave a note instead.
If it differs along the way, the first step is to split up the way. After that, the quest can be answered for each part separately.\nSplit it now?
Tap on the way to split it at the point(s) where the answer differs. Use the zoom function and try to be as precise as possible.
These are quite a few splits. You can always further split up the way later.
It’s at a slightly different position…
You can correct the position by moving the feature.\nMove it now?
Moved too far. Consider leaving a note
Drag the map to place the feature at the correct position. Use the zoom function and try to be as precise as possible. Please be aware that your displayed location may be less exact than displayed.
Are you sure you checked this on-site?
Only information that was found on a survey should be entered.
Don’t show again for this session
StreetComplete makes it easy to contribute to OpenStreetMap.\nIt automatically looks for missing details in your vicinity: bicycle lanes, house numbers, opening hours and much more…
Once found, the missing details will appear on your map as quests.\n\nYou can start solving them right away and later login to publish your answers.
Whenever you are uncertain, you can always reply “Can’t Say” and leave a note.\n\nFinally, remember to stay safe: Be aware of your surroundings and don’t enter private property.
Adding a photo will make the note much more useful.
Do you want to delete this picture?
Unable to create file for photo
The permission is required to measure distances with the camera.
This edit is already synced and cannot be undone
This app is too old, try updating.
Something went wrong. Try restarting the measuring.
Camera is used by another app
Too steep of an angle, step away a bit
Keep closer to the arrow but watch out for traffic!

"

ARCore sometimes (initially) presumes the ground to be a bit lower or higher than it actually is. This introduces a measurement error that gets larger the more you tilt your phone towards the horizon.

Set each the start- and endpoint while pointing the phone straight down (so that you see the white arrow from above) to completely avoid this issue for horizontal measurements.

For vertical measurements, you need to instead check that the startpoint does not seem to move in relation to the ground by looking at it from different directions.

"
You have %d unread messages in your inbox

"Contributing should primarily be fun!
If you are overwhelmed by the number of quests, you can always fine-tune which quests are displayed to you and in what order in the settings.
When mapping the same area together in a group, you can enter team mode to split up quests between all team members.
How many people are mapping? Enter the same number on everyone’s phone.
Team mode works for groups of 2 to 12 people.
Next, each person must pick a different color. Choose yours:
"You need to authorize with your OSM user account to publish your answers. Authorize now?"
You can also do this later on the profile screen.
"This version of StreetComplete is too old. Please update!"
"To scan for quests around you automatically, turn on location"
"Connection error while scanning for quests. Try again later."
"Connection error while uploading answers. Try again later."
"Send an error report to the developer?"
Thank you for considering supporting this app! To see current donations and to donate yourself, tap on the respective platform:

"Thank you for considering supporting this app! Unfortunately, due to Google Play Store policy, no links leading to donations may be displayed in-app. In this context, even linking to our project home is not allowed."

"

Ah, someone who cares about privacy, nice! I think I have only good news for you:

Direct Contributions

First off, understand that with this app, you make actual and direct contributions to OpenStreetMap (OSM).
Anything you contribute in this app is directly added to the map, there is no third party in-between the app and OSM infrastructure.

Editing OpenStreetMap anonymously is not possible. Any changes you make (and their date and location) are attributed to your OSM user account and publicly visible on the openstreetmap.org website. Because StreetComplete should only be used for on-site survey, this reveals where and when you have used the app.

Location

The app does not share your GPS location with anyone. It is used to automatically scan for and download quests around you, and position the map at your location.

Data Usage

This app directly communicates with OSM servers.
Before uploading your changes, the app checks with a simple text file on my server to ensure that this version of the app has not been banned from uploading changes. This is a precautionary measure to be able to block versions of the app that turn out to have critical bugs from uploading corrupted data to OSM.

"

"

To display the map, vector tiles are retrieved from %1$s. See their privacy statement for more information.

"
Photos you attach to a note are uploaded to my server and deleted some days after that note has been resolved. Their meta-data is stripped before upload.
For some quests, some additional data from third parties is downloaded. In particular, the oneway quest queries an API, also hosted on westnordost.de, about likely candidates for oneways.
The data shown in your profile is aggregated from your publicly available contribution history to OpenStreetMap and then hosted on my server.
This application runs on Google Play Services for AR (ARCore), which is provided by Google and governed by the Google Privacy Policy.
You have %d not yet published changes. You need to login to have them uploaded.
"Authorization failed: All listed permissions need to be granted"
Your statistics are still syncing. Check this screen later.
Learning more about OSM and its community
Editors and other ways to contribute to OpenStreetMap
Interesting map-related stuff for you to try out
Discover indoor maps of malls, railway stations etc.
A map for finding wheelchair-accessible places
A map that shows buildings in 3D
Discover vegetarian and vegan restaurants in your city
Create tactile maps easily for any address
Tactile maps for the visually impaired in various scales
Fully-featured OSM editor for the desktop. This is the power tool for regular contributors.
Simple OSM editor for the browser. Optimized for the desktop or large tablets
Create maps with custom data quickly and embed them in your site
A map of public transport routes and stops
Contribute to OSM simply by looking at pictures of your city
The wiki is your starting point to everything related to OpenStreetMap
New to OpenStreetMap? This is a beginner’s guide
A huge collection of statistics for OpenStreetMap contributors, like where and how you contributed, who else is around you plus leaderboards
Map that shows recent natural disasters, interesting for humanitarian mappers. Also, shows many interesting statistics to analyze how well-mapped and up-to-date places are.
General information about OpenStreetMap and how to work with OSM as an organization
A service and app for sharing crowdsourced street-level photos, with explicit permission to use them for contributing to OSM
Explore OSM data across scales from the "big picture" up to individual objects over space and time
A service and app for sharing crowdsourced street-level photos, with explicit permission to use them for contributing to OSM
The geocoder for OSM data, used by many other services
A standalone extension to Nominatim, featuring fuzzy search and search-as-you-type
Render all roads of a city, for printing on T-Shirts, mugs,…
"Generate printable city maps in a few easy steps, optionally with a street directory"
Probably the best routing engine for cyclists
Watch OSM edits happen in real time
Routing engine with a very small memory footprint, multi-modal routing, isochrones and more.
Routing for a variety of vehicles and on foot, each with preferences. Can also show isochrones (reachable area in X minutes from a starting point).
Using OSM data to generate a haiku (a form of Japanese poetry)
A map showing power, telecoms, gas, and oil infrastructure
Create printable maps for the orienteering sport
A map to browse OpenStreetMap map features by category
A map with searchable places and directions
Maps app for travelers, hikers and cyclists that works offline
Mobile app for online and offline map viewing and navigation
The weekly news blog about what’s happening in the OpenStreetMap world
Create figure-ground diagram posters of a city or neighbourhood
A map of cameras and surveillance equipment
"Lookup, add and edit fire stations and fire hydrants"
How well do you know your area? Test your knowledge by locating streets.
Conveniently see, filter and comment on notes created by you and others. Many notes can be solved by putting the information contained in them on the map with iD or JOSM
Welcome to the OpenStreetMap community! In your profile screen, you can see more about each type of quest you’ve solved.
You solved %d quests! Keep going to unlock more achievements that contain links to OSM and other map-related apps and projects!
You contributed %d days to OSM with this app! Regular contributors are the backbone of OSM, thanks for your dedication! ❤
You solved %d quests that help cyclists!
You solved %d quests that help wheelchair users get around town!
You helped to locate %d addresses!\nThis data is essential not only for the mail carrier but also for any navigation system.
You solved %d building related quests.\nNote that this app asks for the house number of a building only after its type has been determined.
You solved %d quests that are interesting for visually impaired.
You solved %d quests that are interesting for people on foot!
You solved %d quests that are interesting for people living on a no-meat diet!
You solved %d quests that improve detail on the street infrastructure, putting the “street” in OpenStreetMap!
You found and solved %d quests that are rarely completed, congratulations!
You solved %d quests that are useful for everyday life in town!
You solved %d quests that are useful for outdoor enthusiasts!
You solved %d quests that help emergency services and first responders!
To upload your changes manually, use the button in the toolbar that looks like this.
"Space in megabytes reserved on external storage to cache map tiles"
"Also showing notes not phrased as questions"
Delete all downloaded map data, including quests?\nData is refreshed after %1$s days and unused data is deleted after %2$s days automatically.
If you think some data is outdated
Reset both quest enablement and order to the default?
"Delete preset “%s”? The quest selection and order for it will be irrevocably lost."
Let others scan this QR code to share your preset.
Note: Your preset with the same name will be overwritten!
You can switch presets in the settings at any time.
"After installing the app, scan the QR code again or click this link to apply the preset."
Are credit or debit cards accepted here?
An Assembly Point is where people assemble in case of an emergency. It usually looks similar to this:
Are pedestrians forbidden to walk on this road here?
This street was tagged as having no sidewalk on either side. If there is a sidewalk but it is displayed as a separate way, please answer “sidewalk”.
"What’s the house number of this building?"
"You can enter comma-separated house numbers or ranges.\nFor example 1,3 or 2-6."
It does not belong to a named street…
Tap street on map to select it
"Can you deposit cash at this ATM?"
"Does this place have a baby changing table?"
What type of barrier is this?
What type of stile is this?
How does this path cross the barrier here?
How does this road cross the barrier here?
Grid blocking livestock from walking over
Converted into a passage in a wall/fence/etc.
Does this bench have a backrest?
What type of bicycle barrier is this?
Not a cycle barrier, but some other barrier
Can this cycle barrier be opened (with or without a key)?
Who is allowed to park a bicycle here? Parking may be free or paid.
"Is this bicycle parking covered (protected from rain)?"
Do you have to pay to park a bicycle here?
What type of bicycle parking is this?
How many rental bicycle spaces are here?
What type of bicycle rental is this?
Bicycle store that also rents bicycles
Are bicycle repair services offered here?
"How many bicycles can be parked here?"
"Note that many stands can be used to park one bicycle on each side."
Is there a public bicycle pump here (at least when it’s open)?
Is there a working bicycle pump here?
Is there an air compressor available here?
What’s the topic of this information board?
Is it just a map and only a map?

If the board is about a particular topic, please specify it, regardless of whether it also includes a map. For example a public transport board may have a bus route map. If the topic is not listed among the available answers, please consider leaving a note instead.
What type of bollard is this?
Not a bollard, but some other barrier
What’s the structure of this bridge?
What kind of building entrance is this?
Main entrance of a public building
Stairwell entrance (e.g. to an apartment building)
"How many levels above the basement does this building have?"
"How many levels above the basement does this building part have?"
In this case, simply input the values of the highest building part.
Please select a more specific value.
Simply select the main purpose of this building. E.g. if there is a shop on the ground floor with apartments above it, it is still mainly an apartment building.
non-detached single-family home, e.g. a single row house
house for multiple families, may have retail outlets on the ground floor
a linear row of similar single-family homes
small detached house (summer house, holiday cottage, cabin…)
building where people work, shop or do other commercial activities
e.g. a factory, workshop, car repair garage,…
including buildings for restaurants, cafés, stores…
public building usually housing an amenity
the residential building on a farm
any building on a farm that is not a residential building
building with machinery like pumps or transformers
storage for airplanes, helicopters or spacecraft
building of historic value, constructed for an unknown or unclear purpose
unused building whose original function or purpose is unknown
"Is there a bench at this stop?"
"Is there a waste basket at this stop?"
"What number or code identifies this stop?"
"Is there a shelter at this stop?"
What type of surveillance camera is this?
Is drinking water freely available to campers here?
Is there any way for customers to charge their phone, laptop etc. here?
Both tents and motor homes, travel trailers, …
What kind of car wash is this?
"How many cars can be charged here at the same time?"
"Who is the operator of this charging station?"
"Who accepts donations for this clothing bin?"
Are there curbs where this way meets this road here? What kind?
What kind of crossing is this?
"Is there a bicycle lane or path here? What type?"
"Is this still the cycling situation here?"
lane shared explicitly with other traffic
sidepath or protected bicycle lane, both directions
none, but cyclists may use road in both directions
none, no cycling allowed in this direction
none, but shoulder is usable for cyclists
Also bicycle path on the other side…
No bicycle lane or path at all

As usual, tap on one side of the illustration, select a proper answer and do the same for the other side.\n\nNote all the available options: some cases are not obvious, like a oneway road that allows cyclists in both directions!
Selecting that there is no bicycle lane or path
Are you sure that cyclists are not allowed to use this one-way street in both directions? If you’re unsure, look for a sign at the end of the street.
What’s the surface of the bicycle path here?
"How wide is the bicycle path here?"
Halal products must be prepared according to special rules, with Halal certification agencies marking products in compliance.
Kosher products must be prepared according to special rules, with kashrut certification agencies marking products in compliance.
Any vegan items on the menu here?
Vegan meals contain no animal products (no meat, fish, poultry, milk products, eggs, honey…).
Any vegetarian items on the menu here?
Vegetarian meals contain no meat, fish, or poultry.
Only answer “yes” if the place provides a comparable choice of eating options for this diet
How is drinking water provided here?
Water fountain emitting small jet of water
Does this ferry route transport pedestrians?
Does this ferry route transport motor vehicles?
What diameter is specified on the sign for this fire hydrant?
This diameter looks implausible, it is usually between %1$d and %2$d.
Where is this fire hydrant located?
What kind of fire hydrant is this?
What’s the surface of the footpath here?
Does this gas station allow self-service?
Do you need to pay to enter here?
Is this also here outside of winter?
Do these steps have a handrail?
What kind of internet connection does this place offer?
Is this defibrillator (AED) inside a building?
What’s the height of this curb?
A bit higher than road surface
"How many car lanes does this road have?"
"Each side has a different number of lanes"
"Specify the total number of marked lanes (both directions) usable by car traffic. Bicycle and dedicated parking lanes don’t count. If any lanes are reserved for buses, please leave a note instead."
"Specify the number of marked lanes usable by car traffic here. Bicycle and dedicated parking lanes don’t count. If any lanes are reserved for buses, please leave a note instead."
"It has a two-way left turn lane"
Do the trees here have needles or leaves?
On which level number is this place located?
What’s the height limit below the bridge?
If it doesn’t apply for the whole way, consider answering “%s”.
Is there easily enough space for even the tallest trucks (at least about 4.5 meters / 15 feet) to pass through?
This height looks implausible. Are you sure that it is correct?
"What’s the speed limit for this street?"
So, there is a sign like this?
"Are you sure no limit is posted?"
"Did you check at the ends of the street? If there are no signs along the whole street which apply for the highlighted section, default speed limits apply."
Roads in built-up areas have a lower default speed limit than rural roads.
"If there is a sign like this at the intersection with the main road, you may not find individual signs within the zone, as the speed limit posted there applies to the whole zone."
Are opposite directions of traffic separated by a physical barrier or greenspace? The default speed limit depends on whether this is the case.

This quest type is disabled by default because you are usually required to check the whole street for speed limit signs, not just the highlighted section. This can sometimes be a lot of work just to solve a single quest.
This weight looks implausible. Are you sure that it is correct?
Would you like to leave a note? A note with a photo will enable other mappers to take care of it.
What kind of memorial is this?
How many motorcycles can be parked here?
Is this motorcycle parking covered (protected from rain)?
"Can you contribute anything to this note?"
"Is this a one-way street? In which direction?"
"In other words, is it open any time, every day?"
"Be concise, ideally use the wording from the sign, e.g. “by appointment”. The absence of a sign does not necessarily mean that there are no regular opening hours."
You need to describe what is on the sign. If there is no sign, you should ask for the opening hours inside.
Who is allowed to park here? Parking may be free or paid.
Any member of the general public
Any person visiting a specific place (e.g. customers only)
Do you have to pay to park here?
No, but there is a max duration…
What kind of parking is this?
"Does this pedestrian crossing have an island?"
Is this picnic table covered (protected from rain)?
Who is allowed to use this playground?
Which type of police station is this?
What are the pickup times of this collection box?
Are the pickup times of this collection box still correct?
What’s the royal cypher on this postbox?
What barriers are used at this railway crossing?
Can only glass bottles and jars be recycled here, or any type of glass?
Types of glass that are often not accepted: tempered glass, window panes, glassware, light bulbs or mirrors.
What can be left here for recycling?
If anything not listed can be recycled here, please leave a note instead.
So, this is a container for any waste, such as bagged up household or commercial waste?
What type of recycling facility is this?
What religion is practiced at this place?
What religion is this shrine associated with?

"The roadway width from curb to curb: This includes anything on the street surface, including on-street parking or bicycle lanes but excluding anything beyond the curb like sidewalks, off-street parking or adjacent bicycle paths."
"This width looks implausible. Remember, this should be the width from curb to curb, including on-street parking, bicycle lanes etc."
"What basic shape does this building’s roof have?"

This quest type is disabled by default because roof shapes are often not easily visible from the street. This quest type is also quite time-consuming; in most cases it is easier and more efficient to map this from aerial imagery at home.
What kind of seating does this place have?
How are the footpath and bicycle path laid out here?
Cyclists and pedestrians share the same space
What type of shop is this?
This shop has been vacant. What’s here now?
"Does this road have a shoulder or breakdown lane?"

"A shoulder or breakdown lane is a clearly marked emergency stopping lane. The area designated as the shoulder is not necessarily paved over its entire width and not necessarily wide enough for a car to stop completely off the traffic lane."
"What’s the surface of the sidewalk here?"
sidewalk, but displayed separately on map
Tap one side and select the matching answer.\nDo the same for the other side if present.
What’s the surface quality of this square?
What’s the surface quality of this road here?
Only small cracks, gaps, repairs or a little rough surface
Unusually flat stones, regular pattern, very shallow or narrow gaps
Hard-packed, very little loose gravel or sand
Unusually rough surface, wider gaps, cracks, shallow ruts, potholes or other damage
Wider gaps, possibly some displaced stones or other damage
Flat stones or with square edges, shallow or narrow gaps
Fine gravel, shallow bumps or potholes
Big gaps, potholes, ruts, crumbled paving or other damage
Displaced stones, big gaps or other damage
Weathered stone or irregular shapes, big gaps or damage
Some bigger gravel, bumps, ruts or potholes
Deep potholes, ruts or other dangerous damage
Big gaps, displaced, missing or irregularly shaped stones or dangerous damage
Missing and broken stones, gaps or other dangerous damage
Some large stones, deep potholes, bumps, ruts, erosion or other hazardous damage
Properly usable only by off-road vehicles or on foot
Properly usable only by specialized off-road vehicles or on foot
Unfit for any vehicle, only passable on foot
Please provide an answer for the overall smoothness. Single obstacles like kerbs, speed bumps or cattle grids can be ignored. Repeated or unexpected obstacles should count towards the answer.
🚲, 🚗, 🚙,… indicate for which vehicles the surface should be usable. What matters is the big picture rather than single hazards.
"Is this sports field designed for exactly these sports specifically (markings and equipment are present) or as a general purpose sports field for all kinds of games?"
Which direction leads upwards for these steps?
Just the number of steps to reach the top. If the step count differs on each side, give the higher number.
Do these steps have a ramp? What kind?
Is the wheelchair ramp displayed as a separate way on the map?
"as written on the street sign, abbreviations are expanded:"
"Can’t type the characters on the sign"

"If you use a default keyboard, chances are that you can simply enable the keyboard layout for the language you need in the input method settings.
Otherwise, you can download another keyboard in the app store. Popular keyboards that support many languages are Google Gboard, SwiftKey Keyboard, and Multiling O Keyboard."
"It is something like a driveway or parking aisle"
"It is an agricultural or forest road"
None of the above, it simply has no name

"Sometimes the street sign is only at one end of the street. Also, note that there may not be extra street signs for side streets that belong to a bigger street. Usually, any street with houses has a name."
"If the name can be spelled without an abbreviation, then it should be expanded. Many common abbreviations are expanded automatically while you type, but probably not all."
"What surface does this piece of road have?"
Is there a summit cross here?
Is there a summit register here?
"Select the most specific one that fits:"

Are you sure that it is impossible to specify the surface? Note the “Differs along the way” answer option that allows you to cut the way where the surface changes. Please use “Can’t say” if there is a single surface but it is not available as an answer.
Please briefly specify the nature of the surface here, for example “sandy with patches of cobblestone”. The text length is limited to 255 characters.

This answer does not match what is already mapped about this road. Are you sure that you are answering about the correct road? Are you sure that you personally surveyed along entire length, as always needed?
"Does this crosswalk have tactile paving on both sides?"
Is there tactile paving on this curb here?
"Do you have to pay to use this restroom?"
What type of tourist information is this?
What’s the surface firmness of this track?
What is signed at this entrance?
Entrance label and range of flats
No sign with label or flat range
What type of traffic calming is this?
Do these traffic lights have a button to request a walk signal?
Are there sound signals for the blind here?
Hint: Look out for speakers. Not all sound signals can be activated through a button.
Do these traffic lights have a tactile indication for blind people for when it’s safe to cross?
Hint: Often this is a vibrating button or rotating cone on the underside of the traffic light button case.
Is the restroom at this place wheelchair accessible?
Partially means that there is no more than an ankle-high step to access the place and that most rooms inside are wheelchair accessible.
Partially means that there is no more than an ankle-high step to access it.
Partially means that there is no more than an ankle-high step to access it.
"A wheelchair sign like this might be visible if the restroom is accessible. Partially means that a wheelchair can enter and use the restroom, but no handrail or adapted hand basin is present."
Not designated for cyclists (cycling may still be allowed)
Bike-only path with adjacent sidewalk (separated by a curb)
A bike path that goes into the other direction is extremely rare.
"In that case, the opening hours, contact information etc. will have changed, too."
Split into cycling and walking parts
"Adjacent to street only in dedicated spaces"
No explicit sign / parking not possible

"If it is at all possible to park or stop here, please answer how those who might park here can do so. Which restrictions apply exactly can be specified later.
Alternatively, you can leave a note (with a photo)."
